text: Brickellia lancifolia is a Mexican species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It is native to southern Mexico in the state of Oaxaca.Robinson, Benjamin Lincoln & Greenman, Jesse More 1895. American Journal of Science, ser. 4 50(296): 153Tropicos, Brickellia lancifolia B.L. Rob. & Greenm. Brickellia lancifolia is a branching shrub up to 240 cm (8 feet) tall. Its leaves partially surround the stems. The plant produces many small, nodding (hanging) flower heads with purple disc florets but no ray florets. ==References== ==External links== *Photo of herbarium specimen at Missouri Botanical Garden, collected in Oaxaca, isotype of Brickellia lancifolia lancifolia Category:Flora of Oaxaca Category:Plants described in 1895
